intro: Epilasia bungei, commonly known as the Bunge's epilasia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 centimeters, with slender stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achene seeds that are dispersed by wind. Epilasia bungei is adapted to survive in harsh environments, showcasing resilience through deep root systems and water conservation mechanisms.
